  • La possibilité d’évoluer et de monter en compétences grâce à des formations et à des certifications auprès de nos clients et de nos consultants, des 12@13, notre Entité Softeam Institute, Organisme de formation interne de renommé qui délivre des formations auprès de nos clients...

QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

  • SOFTEAM DATA est une marque de DOCAPOSTE spécialisée dans l'informatique décisionnelle et les nouvelles technologies. Nous apportons notre expertise à nos clients, principalement des Grands Comptes de la place financière française, dans des projets de transformation digitale et cognitive.
  • 2000 Softeamien.nes sont dédié.es à la transformation métier et digitale de nos clients et ont généré 200 M€ de chiffre d’affaires en 2020.

SOFTEAM SPIRIT

  • Des communautés d'expertises sur les sujets de la Data
  • De super nouveaux locaux qui sont en plus accessibles facilement
  • Une école de formation intégrée
  • Des évènements : des soirées avec les consultants, des 12@13...
  • Une entreprise labellisée "Happy at Work" pour la 5ème année consécutive.

N’attendez plus, rejoignez SOFTEAM et venez nous rencontrer dans nos nouveaux locaux situés à la Défense #DevenezSofteamien !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

En MRM buscamos un/a Data Analyst para sumarse a nuestro equipo de Data Science & Business Intelligence, participando en proyectos innovadores para grandes marcas y sectores internacionales.

¿Qué harás?


Analizar comportamiento de usuarios y clientes mediante consultas SQL avanzadas, generando insights accionables para campañas y estrategias.
Recoger, estructurar e implementar briefings de análisis específicos adaptados a cada cliente o proyecto.
Diseñar y automatizar dashboards interactivos con herramientas como Power BI, Tableau, Qlik o Data Studio, orientados a marketing, ventas o customer experience.
Definir y aplicar metodologías estadísticas como A/B Testing y grupos de control paramedir impacto real de acciones.
Coordinar y asegurar la entrega de reports periódicos con foco en calidad, claridad y puntualidad.
Comunicar resultados y hallazgos de manera clara y con visión estratégica, tanto a nivel interno como en reuniones con cliente externo.


¿Qué buscamos en ti?


Espíritu de equipo y capacidad para trabajar en entornos colaborativos con perfiles de distintas disciplinas, países y culturas.
Proactividad, energía positiva y fuerte ambición profesional.
Atención al detalle y mentalidad analítica.
Creatividad e innovación: no buscamos replicadores de modelos, sino personas que aporten ideas nuevas y valientes.
Mentalidad crítica y orientada a la mejora continua.
Capacidad de adaptación a la presión sin perder foco en la calidad.
Gusto por el marketing, el entorno digital y la relación con los datos.


Requisitos Técnicos Imprescindibles


SQL avanzado: agilidad en la extracción, manipulación y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos. Súper enfocado en el dato, con gran cuidado en la precisión de los resultados asegurando unos entregables de calidad y 100% fiables.
Conocimiento sólido de entornos de BI y analítica.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Data Studio).
Rigor y cuidado extremo en validaciones y revisiones de datos.
Capacidad de estructurar briefings y transformar preguntas de negocio en análisis efectivos.


Sobre MRM

MRM es una agencia de experiencias digitales que ofrece soluciones creativas transformadoras en la intersección de los negocios, el data y la tecnología. MRM opera de forma integrada y sin fronteras, para permitir una mayor colaboración y velocidad, todo ello con el objetivo de ayudar a las empresas a establecer relaciones significativas con las personas. MRM forma parte de McCann Worldgroup y del grupo de empresas Interpublic (NYSE: IPG) y cuenta con 35 oficinas en América del Norte, América Latina, Europa, Oriente Medio y Asia Pacífico.


McCann Worldgroup manifiesta su compromiso con la igualdad y la diversidad.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Index Data Analyst – Asset Management

Location- Dublin (onsite)

Type- Permanent role




Responsibilities

To maintain the timeliness and integrity of core business data with particular emphasis on index data. Indices are critical to investment management, performance attribution, risk management and portfolio monitoring. This will involve taking ownership and responsibility for certain processes including the investigation and resolution of incidents.
To oversee the daily production and delivery of index data to our data consumers, ensuring that all data has been delivered and that any issues have been flagged up, escalated and resolved.
To take an active role in on-boarding new indices and new consumers to our strategic data distribution platform. To perform data quality checks to ensure that new indices are complete, accurate and timely in target systems.
To work closely with our Vendor Management team in working with our index data vendors, including creating, agreeing and monitoring service levels and tracking open incidents, requests and queries.
To understand the business use of index data including custom indices, carve-outs and composite blends; to work closely with the investment teams and other consumers and deal with any data queries and issues.
To gather and create management information data on the usage of index data across the business.




Requirements

Bachelor’s degree or master’s Degree (or equivalent)
Minimum 2 - 4 years of experience in Index Operations
Good understanding of index data, index data providers, index composition and index feed file types
Good understanding of index valuation types and calculating index returns
Good understanding of performance measurement, performance attribution, performance management and performance reporting
Good understanding of market data and reference data spanning equities and fixed income; this will include instrument identification, industrial classifications, pricing and corporate events
Understanding of emerging trends in ESG and alternative dataset
Understanding of currency hedging
A background in investment management data or financial data management
Proactive problem solver who takes responsibility for finding a solution and for driving continuous improvement
Proficient with MS Excel, file handling tools and SQL
Excellent time management skills
Calm under pressure
Willing to start the day at 8am.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • Strong SQL proficiency;
  • Experience with Power BI or similar BI tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.) — building them based on real data questions;
  • Deep understanding of website or app tracking data — working with event-level/session-level data, building user flows, and analyzing behavior over time;
  • Solid background in product analysis using hit-level data (e.g. from Google Analytics or similar systems);
  • Practical use of statistics in daily work;
  • Extensive A/B testing experience, including test design, implementation, and interpretation of results to guide decision-making;
  • Good understanding of ETL processes, data pipelines, and how data flows through modern analytics environments;
  • Working knowledge of Python for data analysis (e.g., using pandas, numpy, statsmodels) or for automating small-scale data workflows;
  • Experience with PySpark or similar big data tools, particularly in distributed data environments;
  • Fluency in English, both written and spoken.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: remote;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you !


Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract;

Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for two years period).

The collected data might be transferred or include other processing activities, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law.

For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL’s headquarters in Avenida Duque D`Ávila, nº46 em Lisboa or use the DPO’s e-mail - dpo@aubay.pt. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority – www.cnpd.pt.

(please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to criminal convictions and offences.)

Title: Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
Description:
This is a remote position.

Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in data analysis!


If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.





Internship Overview and Details:


Location: Fully remote


Schedule: Full-time internship





Ideal Candidates:


Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.

Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights.

Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations.

Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings.

Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments.

Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis.

Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued.

Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous.

Some initial industry experience is a big plus.



Your Contribution:


Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes.

Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights.

Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making.

Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges.

Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis.

Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations.


Why Join Us?


Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!


Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Als Data Analyst ben je verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren, structureren en toegankelijk maken van data die voortkomt uit onze CRM-, CDP-systemen en uiteenlopende klant- en marktonderzoeken. Jouw inzichten ondersteunen de volledige organisatie in het nemen van datagedreven beslissingen. Daarnaast speel je een sleutelrol in het analyseren van digitale performantie via o.a. Google Analytics, met een specifieke focus op Performance Marketing inzichten  & aanbevelingen ter visualisatie.

Een greep uit jouw takenpakket:

Je staat in voor de analyse van klantendata.
Je interpreteert en structureert resultaten uit kwantitatieve en kwalitatieve klant- en marktonderzoeken. 
Je zorgt voor een duidelijke rapportage.
Je identificeert trends, patronen en opportuniteiten in klantgedrag en marktontwikkeling. 
Je vertaalt complexe datasets naar toegankelijke inzichten voor verschillende afdelingen (marketing, sales, productontwikkeling, klantendienst, enz.).
Je werkt samen met marketingteams om campagneresultaten (SEA, display, social, email, enz.) te evalueren en optimaliseren.
Je fungeert als als brug tussen data en business: vertalen van vragen uit de organisatie naar relevante analyses.
Je presenteert inzichten aan zowel technische als niet-technische stakeholders.


Ben jij een ervaren data-professional met zin om klantdata om te zetten in slimme inzichten?

Je hebt een bachelor of master in een relevante richting.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als data analyst en/of data engineer in een klantgerichte of marketingcontext.
Je hebt sterke kennis van en ervaring met CRM- en CDP-data (bijv. Dynamics CE, Salesforce, etc.).
Vertrouwd met onderzoeksmethodologieën (enquête-analyse, segmentatie, NPS, marktonderzoek).
Ervaring met datamodellering en hoe data logisch te structureren en integreren voor analyse, rapportering en businessgebruik.
Gevorderde ervaring met Google Analytics (inclusief GA4); ervaring met tagbeheer (Google Tag Manager) is een plus.
Kennis van BI-tools zoals b.v. Power BI.
Ervaring met SQL en/of Python/R is een voordeel.



Bouw jij mee aan de brug tussen data en business?

Analytisch sterk en in staat complexe zaken eenvoudig uit te leggen.
Proactief, zelfstandig en resultaatgericht.
Je bent communicatief sterk en een ware bruggenbouwer tussen data en business.
Je bent nauwkeurig en kwaliteitsgericht.



Zin in een impactvolle job binnen een ambitieuze organisatie?

Een competitief salaris in lijn met jouw ervaring, aangevuld met een uitgebreid pakket extralegale voordelen en toegang tot DELA’s flexplan.
Al meer dan 80 jaar ontzorgt DELA Belgen in één van de moeilijkste momenten in hun leven. Of het nu gaat om uitvaartverzekering, een repatriëring, nabestaandenzorg of de uitvaart zelf. Dit is wat onze job zinvol maakt en ons de energie geeft om er stees te staan als één team.
DELA werd tot 4de keer bekroond als World Class Workplace - dankzij focus op persoonlijke ontwikkeling & training, duurzaamheid, leiderschap,... en we jaarlijks alle collega's samenbrengen op ons bedrijfsevent.
De kracht van coöperatie DELA staat of valt met onze mensen. Collega’s met verschillende achtergronden, leeftijden en elke persoonlijke identificatie en voorkeur verwelkomen wij graag.  

Interesse in DELA's manier van werken? Solliciteer online & we kijken alvast uit je te ontmoeten.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Power BI)
Description:
En Keepler queremos hacer crecer nuestro equipo con personas que tengan ganas de desarrollar software basado en datos con dos objetivos: ayudar en la transformación a nuestros clientes y disfrutar del proceso de crear valor a través de la tecnología.




Si quieres ser parte de un equipo que te ofrecerá retos tecnológicos y que te exigirá una mejora y aprendizaje continuo, si no tienes miedo a reconocer errores y eres capaz de ser proactivo y tirar del carro cuando te toque, es posible que Keepler sea el sitio donde deberías trabajar. ¿Te interesa? Echa un vistazo a nuestra vacante de Senior Data Analyst.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Más de 5 años de experiencia como Data Analyst con un perfil analítico muy marcado.
Experiencia en herramientas de reporting (Power BI, QuickSight).
Alto conocimiento y experiencia en lenguaje SQL y con conocimiento en modelo de datos relacionales.
Experiencia en nube (AWS y/o Azure).
Capacidad para trabajar con negocio y para entender procesos complejos asociados con datos.
Experiencia en procesos de recogida de requerimientos para identificar y definir requisitos funcionales.
Buena capacidad de trabajo en equipo.
Inglés B2-C1, imprescindible fluidez a nivel hablado.




Deseable:

Conocimiento de las herramientas complementarias a PowerBI (DAX Studio, Tabular Editor)
Conocimientos sobre el diseño y optimización de bases de datos analíticas.
Experiencia con metodologías Agile.




¿Qué te ofrecemos en Keepler?

Un buen ambiente de trabajo junto a compañeros/as que son unos/as cracks en sus tecnologías y de quienes aprenderás cada día.
Tendrás un presupuesto personal anual de 2.000 euros para que lo dediques a formación y certificaciones.
Teletrabajo con asistencia flexible a la oficina. Nuestra oficina está situada en el centro de Madrid, lo que permite disfrutar de la ciudad en un entorno inmejorable y bien comunicado.
Ayuda económica mensual para consumibles del hogar derivados del teletrabajo.
Horario flexible de entrada y salida y flexibilidad en el almuerzo, para que tu vida personal y profesional encajen sin problema.
Jornada intensiva los viernes todo el año y los meses de julio y agosto.
Ayuda alimentaria de 11 euros al día que podrás recibir en ticket restaurante o en nómina, a tu elección.
Retribución flexible para tarjeta transporte, cheque guardería y seguro médico para familiares.
Formación inglés one-to-one gratis para ti, con 8 sesiones al mes en modalidad online.
Seguro médico privado con una amplia cobertura además de seguro dental y ventajas y precio reducido para tus familiares.
Una compañía con una cultura muy colaborativa que siempre piensa en hacerte la vida profesional más fácil para que solo te preocupes en hacer bien lo que te gusta.
Tendrás acompañamiento de un buddy los primeros meses para que te ayude en la adaptación.
Un ambiente solidario y transparente donde tus decisiones afectan a todos/as en la que prima la solidaridad contigo y con el que está a tu lado.




Así entendemos Keepler, ¿te animas a trabajar con nosotros/as?




We believe en el talento apasionado por la tecnología.




We want personas con diferentes cualidades, mentes inquietas y deseo de aprender, explorar e implementar nuevas tecnologías que aporten valor a cada proyecto.




We invest en el desarrollo continuo de nuestros profesionales.




We foster una cultura de equipo y generosidad.




Rango Salarial: 47.000 - 56.000 euros brutos/anuales + bono




El salario que te ofrecemos responde a un rango salarial que depende de tu experiencia.

Show more
HTML:
En Keepler queremos hacer crecer nuestro equipo con personas que tengan ganas de desarrollar software basado en datos con dos objetivos: ayudar en la transformación a nuestros clientes y disfrutar del proceso de crear valor a través de la tecnología.


Si quieres ser parte de un equipo que te ofrecerá retos tecnológicos y que te exigirá una mejora y aprendizaje continuo, si no tienes miedo a reconocer errores y eres capaz de ser proactivo y tirar del carro cuando te toque, es posible que Keepler sea el sitio donde deberías trabajar. ¿Te interesa? Echa un vistazo a nuestra vacante de Senior Data Analyst.


¿Qué buscamos en ti?

  • Más de 5 años de experiencia como Data Analyst con un perfil analítico muy marcado.
  • Experiencia en herramientas de reporting (Power BI, QuickSight).
  • Alto conocimiento y experiencia en lenguaje SQL y con conocimiento en modelo de datos relacionales.
  • Experiencia en nube (AWS y/o Azure).
  • Capacidad para trabajar con negocio y para entender procesos complejos asociados con datos.
  • Experiencia en procesos de recogida de requerimientos para identificar y definir requisitos funcionales.
  • Buena capacidad de trabajo en equipo.
  • Inglés B2-C1, imprescindible fluidez a nivel hablado.


Deseable:

  • Conocimiento de las herramientas complementarias a PowerBI (DAX Studio, Tabular Editor)
  • Conocimientos sobre el diseño y optimización de bases de datos analíticas.
  • Experiencia con metodologías Agile.


¿Qué te ofrecemos en Keepler?

  • Un buen ambiente de trabajo junto a compañeros/as que son unos/as cracks en sus tecnologías y de quienes aprenderás cada día.
  • Tendrás un presupuesto personal anual de 2.000 euros para que lo dediques a formación y certificaciones.
  • Teletrabajo con asistencia flexible a la oficina. Nuestra oficina está situada en el centro de Madrid, lo que permite disfrutar de la ciudad en un entorno inmejorable y bien comunicado.
  • Ayuda económica mensual para consumibles del hogar derivados del teletrabajo.
  • Horario flexible de entrada y salida y flexibilidad en el almuerzo, para que tu vida personal y profesional encajen sin problema.
  • Jornada intensiva los viernes todo el año y los meses de julio y agosto.
  • Ayuda alimentaria de 11 euros al día que podrás recibir en ticket restaurante o en nómina, a tu elección.
  • Retribución flexible para tarjeta transporte, cheque guardería y seguro médico para familiares.
  • Formación inglés one-to-one gratis para ti, con 8 sesiones al mes en modalidad online.
  • Seguro médico privado con una amplia cobertura además de seguro dental y ventajas y precio reducido para tus familiares.
  • Una compañía con una cultura muy colaborativa que siempre piensa en hacerte la vida profesional más fácil para que solo te preocupes en hacer bien lo que te gusta.
  • Tendrás acompañamiento de un buddy los primeros meses para que te ayude en la adaptación.
  • Un ambiente solidario y transparente donde tus decisiones afectan a todos/as en la que prima la solidaridad contigo y con el que está a tu lado.


Así entendemos Keepler, ¿te animas a trabajar con nosotros/as?


  • We believe en el talento apasionado por la tecnología.


  • We want personas con diferentes cualidades, mentes inquietas y deseo de aprender, explorar e implementar nuevas tecnologías que aporten valor a cada proyecto.


  • We invest en el desarrollo continuo de nuestros profesionales.


  • We foster una cultura de equipo y generosidad.


Rango Salarial: 47.000 - 56.000 euros brutos/anuales + bono


El salario que te ofrecemos responde a un rango salarial que depende de tu experiencia.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities include collecting and analyzing requirements, analyzing data, building data pipelines to load and transform data, measuring data quality, doing code reviews and mentoring junior team members.

Qualifications (required)

Strong experience on SQL and relational databases
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong data modelling experience
Strong experience with Python and Spark
Experience working with data analytics/visualization software.
Experience working in Unix environments
Experience working directly with data consumers to fulfill their needs
Strong networking and collaboration skills
Ability to work independently
Experience navigating large/complex IT environments and infrastructure

Qualifications (nice to have)

Knowledge of the ServiceNow platform
Experience with Agile/DevOps
Knowledge of data governance concepts
Knowledge of data center and IT inventory equipment
Experience working on IT Inventory systems

The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
1 - 2 years' Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL

Title: Medior Data Analyst (PowerBI / DAX / SQL)
Description:
Medior Data Analyst (PowerBI / DAX / SQL)




As a preferred supplier to one of our biggest Financial Client, I am seeking for a Medior Data Analyst (PowerBI / DAX / SQL) for a position in Utrecht, Netherlands. As Medior Data Analyst you work in a team that is situated in a rapidly changing and challenging environment (i.e. external regulatory demands, new innovations, compliance requirements). We expect you to bring your expertise to develop new and revise current Power BI dashboards that meet the needs of our business stakeholders and align with our vision. You gather and define requirements for the dashboards and together with the team you deliver new, valuable information solutions whilst working via the scrum framework.




Practical Examples

Build future proof Power BI dashboards according to requirements based on business needs.
Maintain, simplify and enhance existing dashboards to increase efficiency.




Top responsibilities

Translation of business needs into adequate development requirements and eventually data solutions in the form of a Power BI dashboard
Ensure maintenance and development of the squad data products into future proof and compliant solutions




Core Requirement:

Bachelor or Master Degree
Experienced in Power BI, DAX, SQL
At least 2 years of experience in a similar role
Experience with working Agile/Scrum
Result-oriented with a ca-do-mentality
Strong analytical skills, ability to learn quickly to understand complex topics
Can communicate in English. Dutch is a plus.




Contract: 6+ month

Hours: 36 hours/week

Rates: Excellent

Location: Utrecht

Interview: 2 stages




Nick Chinweerapunt

Account Manager

Gazelle Global Consulting

Tel +31 85 111 0171

Tel+44 203 588 7747

Mob +44 7377 403 773

nick@gazellegc.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
L’Open Banking è il nostro DNA!




Centrico ha le sue radici nelle rivoluzioni tecnologiche guidate dal gruppo Sella e dal 2019 è una realtà indipendente: creiamo innovazione per il mondo delle banche e della finanza con un sistema informativo aperto, veloce, modulabile e conveniente.




Il nostro obiettivo è diventare una data driven company!

Per vincere questa sfida, la persona che cerchiamo farà parte dell’area Data Management di Centrico in qualità di Data Analyst e si occuperà di analizzare i dati per fornire insights utili a supporto dei processi decisionali interni al Gruppo.




Responsabilità:

Analizzerai grandi quantità di dati per identificare trend, pattern e insights utili
Creerai report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile
Collaborerai con team multidisciplinari (Business, IT, Compliance, Risk) per comprendere le esigenze di analisi dei dati e fornire soluzioni data-driven
Supporterai l’individuazione di regole e di livelli di controllo dell'accesso ai dati
Contribuirai al miglioramento continuo della piattaforma dati del Gruppo tramite l’implementazione di best practice e standard di settore




Requisiti:

Esperienza di almeno 4 anni nel medesimo ruolo o in ruolo affine
Laurea in discipline STEM
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Python, R)
Ottima conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione dati (es. Power BI, Tableau)
Ottime capacità relazionali sia verso interlocutori tecnici sia di business
Spiccate capacità analitiche e di problem solving




Nice to have:

Esperienza con tecnologie di big data (es. Hadoop, Spark)
Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning e data mining
Esperienza con strumenti di ETL (es. Talend, Informatica)
Certificazioni professionali in ambito data analysis (es. Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate)
Conoscenza di metodologie Agile e Scrum




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente positivo e in cui il tuo contributo venga apprezzato, la tua opinione è importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
Piattaforma e-learning Microsoft: per non smettere mai di imparare e di certificarti
Attività di engagement (tornei di Beach Volley, Padel, Calcetto) e di volontariato aziendale
Contratto con CCNL del Credito
Cura della persona anche con la polizza sanitaria - per te e il tuo nucleo familiare - e polizza TCM
Supporto al benessere psicologico attraverso Stimulus, uno sportello esterno di ascolto a disposizione dei colleghi e dei loro famigliari
Uno sguardo al tuo futuro attraverso il contributo aziendale al fondo pensione
Policy di lavoro flessibile




Sede di lavoro: Milano o Torino o Biella con modalità ibrida.

Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST - SPECIALISTA EXCEL
Description:
La risorsa verrà inserita all’interno del reparto Pianificazione per potenziamento dell’organico.

In questo ruolo avrai l’opportunità di:


Trasformare dati complessi in analisi chiare e strategiche, fornendo insight preziosi per il business
Monitorare le principali attività aziendali, contribuendo a garantire il raggiungimento degli obiettivi
Analizzare l’andamento del fatturato rispetto all’anno precedente, individuando trend ed opportunità di crescita
Creare e presentare report e presentazioni efficaci, sia per i nostri clienti sia per il management attivo



La figura ricercata dovrà possedere:


Diploma e/o Laurea in ambito economico o simili
Conoscenza approfondita del pacchetto Office
Capacità di elaborazione dati tramite Excel (tabelle pivot, funzioni statistiche, strumenti di analisi, grafici e tabelle dati ecc..)
Capacità di lavorare sia in Team che in Autonomia
Disponibilità Full Time



Fides S.p.A. promuove un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, garantendo pari opportunità di impiego a tutti i candidati qualificati, indipendentemente da origine, sesso, genere, orientamento sessuale o religione.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger—and moving faster. We’re a family-founded company on a mission to create the world’s first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018—and now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco—we’ve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you’ll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management—and change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Data Analyst at Air Apps, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.

This role requires a data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior, product performance, and key business metrics to identify trends and opportunities.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Collect, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and usability.
Define and track KPIs for marketing, product, and business performance.
Work with SQL, Python, or R to extract, analyze, and manipulate data.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams to provide data-driven insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experiment analysis to improve product features and user engagement.
Identify bottlenecks and opportunities in user journeys and customer funnels.
Present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders and leadership teams.
Stay up to date with industry trends, analytics best practices, and emerging data tools.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.


What benefits are we offering?


Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
Annual Bonus.
Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
Air Conference - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


Zalando Stores Experiences & Clearance Solutions is a retail-focused business unit, responsible for managing overstock from across the entire Zalando Group. We operate 15 (and counting) physical outlet stores across Germany, the Zalando Beauty Station in Berlin, and various other overstock channels. While retail is at the core of our operations, we increasingly collaborate on initiatives across the wider Zalando Group – expanding our scope and creating new data needs in the process. In recent years, we have strengthened and streamlined our BI landscape, putting in place cleaner data models, stronger governance, and more unified reporting.

As a BI Analyst (all genders) in Zalando Stores, you will build on this foundation – designing and maintaining robust data models, ensuring high-quality KPIs and dashboards, and making our BI tools more impactful and accessible. You will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, translate them into effective BI solutions, and act as a sparring partner to improve the quality and usability of our data products.

The focus now is on building new data products, refining what already exists, and ensuring our BI solutions keep pace with the evolving needs of a fast-changing retail market and our growing cross-Zalando activities.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be the leading pan-European ecosystem for fashion and lifestyle e-commerce - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-culture/diversity-and-inclusion


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Discover and translate business processes into data models for our data warehouse and Tableau, ensuring they are efficient, scalable, and aligned with current and future business needs.
Write and optimize SQL to create data marts, improve data flows, and support efficient BI performance.
Work with Zalando’s central data teams to ensure data quality, consistent structures, and well-designed ETL processes that support our data needs.
Partner with business stakeholders to design and improve data products that enhance the value and usability of reporting and analysis.
Provide ad-hoc analysis, reporting, and troubleshooting to support operational and strategic decisions.




WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF YOU HAVE




Strong SQL skills with the ability to gather, analyze, and transform data from a data warehouse.
Hands-on experience designing or reshaping data models and troubleshooting data pipelines.
Solid experience with Tableau, including data source management, dashboard creation, and familiarity with advanced features (e.g., LOD calculations, table calculations).
Strong analytical skills, basic statistical literacy, and a data-driven mindset.
Clear and collaborative communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across both technical and non-technical teams.
Ability to organise work, manage deadlines, and handle multiple priorities with guidance when needed.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Lounge by Zalando, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start for full-time employees
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Wellhub, formerly Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review
Show more
HTML:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


Zalando Stores Experiences & Clearance Solutions is a retail-focused business unit, responsible for managing overstock from across the entire Zalando Group. We operate 15 (and counting) physical outlet stores across Germany, the Zalando Beauty Station in Berlin, and various other overstock channels. While retail is at the core of our operations, we increasingly collaborate on initiatives across the wider Zalando Group – expanding our scope and creating new data needs in the process. In recent years, we have strengthened and streamlined our BI landscape, putting in place cleaner data models, stronger governance, and more unified reporting.

As a BI Analyst (all genders) in Zalando Stores, you will build on this foundation – designing and maintaining robust data models, ensuring high-quality KPIs and dashboards, and making our BI tools more impactful and accessible. You will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, translate them into effective BI solutions, and act as a sparring partner to improve the quality and usability of our data products.

The focus now is on building new data products, refining what already exists, and ensuring our BI solutions keep pace with the evolving needs of a fast-changing retail market and our growing cross-Zalando activities.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be the leading pan-European ecosystem for fashion and lifestyle e-commerce - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-culture/diversity-and-inclusion


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



  • Discover and translate business processes into data models for our data warehouse and Tableau, ensuring they are efficient, scalable, and aligned with current and future business needs.
  • Write and optimize SQL to create data marts, improve data flows, and support efficient BI performance.
  • Work with Zalando’s central data teams to ensure data quality, consistent structures, and well-designed ETL processes that support our data needs.
  • Partner with business stakeholders to design and improve data products that enhance the value and usability of reporting and analysis.
  • Provide ad-hoc analysis, reporting, and troubleshooting to support operational and strategic decisions.



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF YOU HAVE



  • Strong SQL skills with the ability to gather, analyze, and transform data from a data warehouse.
  • Hands-on experience designing or reshaping data models and troubleshooting data pipelines.
  • Solid experience with Tableau, including data source management, dashboard creation, and familiarity with advanced features (e.g., LOD calculations, table calculations).
  • Strong analytical skills, basic statistical literacy, and a data-driven mindset.
  • Clear and collaborative communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across both technical and non-technical teams.
  • Ability to organise work, manage deadlines, and handle multiple priorities with guidance when needed.



OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


  • Employee shares program
  • 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Lounge by Zalando, discounts from external partners
  • 2 paid volunteering days a year
  • Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
  • 27 days of vacation a year to start for full-time employees
  • Family services, including counseling and support
  • Health and wellbeing options (including Wellhub, formerly Gympass)
  • Mental health support and coaching available
  • Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Queres fazer parte da mudança?


Então, estás no lugar certo. A nossa ambição é construir um futuro sustentável para os nossos clientes e as nossas equipas... Mas não o podemos fazer sem ti!
Ao integrares o BNP Paribas Personal Finance, participa na nossa grande transformação para construirmos um mundo mais sustentável: estamos empenhados em promover o acesso a um consumo mais responsável e sustentável para apoiar os nossos clientes e parceiros.
Para o conseguir, implementamos ações concretas, não só na forma como desenvolvemos a nossa atividade e melhoramos o nosso crescimento sustentável, com a ambição de reduzir a nossa pegada ambiental, mas também na forma como apoiamos aqueles que mais precisam.


Na prática, o teu dia-a-dia

Como Data Analyst Irás


Projetar, desenvolver e manter soluções analíticas que suportem a monitorização da atividade da empresa e a tomada de decisão estratégica;
Garantir a execução e evolução contínua de relatórios de KPI, dashboards e indicadores de performance;
Explorar e analisar grandes volumes de dados com rigor estatístico, identificando padrões, tendências e oportunidades de melhoria;
Colaborar com stakeholders de negócio para traduzir necessidades em análises acionáveis e recomendações estratégicas.


Contribuirás Também Para a


A implementação de projetos estratégicos do Grupo, com foco em eficiência operacional e inteligência de negócio;
A automação e otimização de processos de reporting e visualização de dados;
A disseminação de boas práticas de análise estatística e cultura data-driven dentro da organização.


A Missão é importante, mas a Equipa e o local de trabalho também!


Bem-vindo/a ao BNP Paribas Personal Finance na Torre Ocidente, Centro Colombo, em Lisboa, onde te irás juntar à Tribo Data e à Squad Reporting & DataViz.
Estamos preparados para te acolher com um plano de integração inicial, com formação on the job, treino e networking.


És tu quem procuramos?

Se és apaixonado/a por estatística clássica, modelos analíticos robustos e pela transformação de dados em valor, esta vaga é para ti!

Vais integrar uma equipa multidisciplinar, colaborativa e com forte espírito de inovação, onde o conhecimento é partilhado e a curiosidade é valorizada.

Procuramos Alguém Com


Licenciatura ou mestrado em Estatística, Engenharia, Matemática, Gestão da Informação, Ciência de Dados ou áreas afins;
Experiência de pelo menos 3 anos em funções similares, com domínio de SQL avançado, Excel, Power Query, Power Pivot e PowerBI (eliminatório);
Conhecimentos em linguagens de programação estatística como R ou Python serão altamente valorizados;
Capacidade de aplicar técnicas estatísticas como regressão, testes de hipóteses, análise de variância, entre outras;
Experiência com ferramentas de visualização como Power BI ou Tableau será um diferencial.


Valorizamos Ainda


Forte capacidade analítica e de investigação;
Autonomia, proatividade e orientação para resultados;
Boa capacidade de comunicação e trabalho em equipa.


Tendo tudo isto, muita vontade, energia e boa disposição, então, és quem procuramos …

Por favor, envia o teu CV em formato PDF, colocando como designação “CV_Nome_Apelido”.

Aguardamos pela tua candidatura!

Os nossos compromissos


O BNP Paribas Personal Finance caracteriza-se por proporcionar igualdade de oportunidades a todos os candidatos a emprego e, enquanto empresa socialmente responsável, incorpora nos seus valores e práticas os princípios da Diversidade e Inclusão.
Para alcançarmos todos os nossos objetivos, pretendemos atrair, desenvolver e reter diferentes perfis, assumindo a diversidade como um fator potenciador e diferenciador de inovação, fundamental na nossa organização.
Se quiseres saber mais sobre a nossa Organização, Valores e Projetos, por favor consulta esta página.


O que nos orgulha enquanto empregadores de referência


Certificação Top Employer Portugal e Top Employer Europa, pelo oitavo ano consecutivo.
93% dos nossos colaboradores identifica o BNP Paribas como uma empresa com “uma gestão inclusiva que apoia todo o tipo de diferenças (idade, origens, orientação sexual, …)”.
94% dos colaboradores identifica-se e beneficia da política de “Smart Working”, sentindo-se confortável num ambiente de trabalho híbrido, e com as ferramentas digitais e espaços de trabalho disponibilizados.
72% dos nossos clientes são promotores da nossa marca
Show more

Title: Posición Junior – Área de Data Science
Description:
¿Te interesa el análisis de datos, la inteligencia artificial y el uso de la estadística para resolver problemas reales? ¿Te gustaría trabajar con empresas tecnológicas que apuestan por el talento con potencial?

Buscamos perfiles junior con mentalidad analítica y ganas de crecer en el mundo de la ciencia de datos.




¿Qué harás en esta posición?

Limpieza, análisis y visualización de grandes volúmenes de datos.
Desarrollo de modelos predictivos y algoritmos de machine learning.
Apoyo en la toma de decisiones basada en datos.
Creación de dashboards e informes para distintos equipos de negocio.
Colaboración en proyectos transversales junto a perfiles técnicos y de negocio.




Perfil que buscamos

Conocimientos básicos de Python, estadística y bases de datos.
Familiaridad con librerías como pandas, sklearn, matplotlib o similares.
Capacidad para interpretar datos y generar insights útiles.
Mentalidad curiosa, estructurada y resolutiva.
Nivel medio de inglés técnico (valorable).




Requisito imprescindible para acceder a esta posición

Antes de integrarte en estos proyectos, será necesario superar una fase práctica previa de 24 semanas, enfocada en dotarte de las habilidades y conocimientos necesarios que este tipo de posiciones requieren en la industria.

Solo los perfiles que completen con éxito esta etapa podrán participar en proyectos reales dentro del ecosistema tecnológico.




¿Qué te ofrecemos al finalizar esta etapa?

Acceso a roles reales en el ámbito de la ciencia de datos.
Experiencia práctica aplicando técnicas de análisis y machine learning.
Acompañamiento y mentoría por parte de profesionales del sector.







Si lo tuyo son los datos, la lógica y el impacto, esta puede ser la puerta que necesitas para iniciar tu carrera.

Aplica ahora y empieza tu camino hacia el mundo del Data Science.

Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Responsable de Análisis de Datos (Sector Movilidad)




¿Te apasiona transformar datos en decisiones estratégicas?

Una empresa líder en el sector de la movilidad y transporte de personas busca un/a Responsable de Análisis de Datos para liderar la evolución de su sistema de información y reporting, impulsando la eficiencia operativa y la mejora continua.




📍 Ubicación: Madrid

💼 Departamento: Operaciones

📅 Contrato: Indefinido

💰 Retribución: 45.000 € - 49.500 € brutos anuales




🧩 Tu misión será:

Diseñar e implementar sistemas de reporting automatizados.
Liderar estrategias de análisis de datos para mejorar la eficiencia y sostenibilidad.
Apoyar decisiones estratégicas mediante informes y recomendaciones basadas en datos.
Colaborar en licitaciones, expansión del negocio y mejora de procesos.




🎯 Requisitos clave:

Grado en ADE, Ingeniería o similar.
+2 años de experiencia en análisis de datos en sectores como movilidad, logística o transporte.
Dominio avanzado de Excel y Power BI.
Conocimientos en estadística, gestión de proyectos y licitaciones.
Deseable inglés y/o francés.




🤝 Lo que valoramos:

Liderazgo, visión estratégica y gestión de equipos.
Capacidad analítica, innovación y tolerancia a la presión.
Compromiso con la sostenibilidad y mejora continua.




📈 ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Proyecto estable en una empresa referente del sector.
Participación activa en decisiones estratégicas.
Entorno colaborativo y multidisciplinar.




🔗 ¿Te interesa? Aplica directamente por aquí..

Title: Addetto/a Inventario – Grande Distribuzione Organizzata
Place: San Ferdinando di Puglia, Apulia, Italy
HTML:
Azienda operante nel settore della grande distribuzione organizzata seleziona una risorsa da inserire all’interno del team con il ruolo di addetto/a all’inventario nei punti vendita.

Attività principali:

Controllo delle scadenze dei prodotti presenti a scaffale e in magazzino;

Verifica delle giacenze tramite dispositivi palmari e strumenti informatici;

Segnalazione di articoli mancanti, in esubero o danneggiati secondo le procedure aziendali;

Supporto al personale di reparto per la sistemazione dell’area dedicata all’inventario.

Requisiti richiesti:

Manualità e precisione;

Capacità di lavorare in ambienti dinamici;

Attitudine al lavoro di squadra;

Disponibilità immediata e a tempo pieno.

Offerta:

Contratto a tempo determinato 12 mesi rinnovabile

Orario full-time 40 ore settimanali dal lunedì al venerdì;

Buoni pasto giornalieri;

Affiancamento iniziale e formazione interna.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
The candidate will play a crucial role in managing and analyzing data for our Claims Department, providing support to the Performance Monitoring Unit and contributing to the full spectrum of claims processes. Your expertise in reporting will be essential in assisting the Business Managers in making informed decisions. We are looking for a talented and proactive individual with strong skills in collaboration. This person should be able to work closely with various Units within the Claims Department, as well as with other teams in our Company, our Group Headquarters, and other Allianz Operating Entities around the world

Key Responsibilities


Design and implement a management controlling system to monitor and track ordinary business and strategic project initiatives.
Monitor the results of initiatives and assess their impact on financial statements.
Collaborate with other Units within the Claims Department and global operating entities to deploy the initiatives of the Plan.
Update and revise priorities listed in the Plan based on observed results of initiatives.
Suggest additional initiatives to ensure the achievement of targets identified in the Plan.
Coordinate reporting preparation and updates at the Allianz Group level


Key Requirements/Skills/Experience


Master's degree in Economics, Business, Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience in a consultancy environment (previous experience in Planning & Controlling, M&A, Data Analytics or equivalent will be considered a plus).
Proactive approach in collaborating with other business functions and Group Headquarters.
Excellent knowledge of:

SAS application platform, particularly SAS Base and SAS Macro programming languages and the Output Delivery System (ODS) module
Microsoft Office™ tools and VBA programming language.
SQL language
Power BI and reporting platforms
Celonis software and process mining analysis
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.

Title: Impiegato/a addetto/a all’accoglienza clienti – Settore Automotive
Description:
Salone espositivo di automobili ricerca un/una impiegato/a addetto/a all’accoglienza clienti per ampliamento dell’organico.

La risorsa selezionata si occuperà di garantire un servizio di accoglienza professionale all’interno dello showroom, supportando l’organizzazione degli appuntamenti e la gestione documentale, in stretta collaborazione con il team commerciale.

Mansioni:

Accoglienza clienti presso il salone espositivo

Gestione e pianificazione degli appuntamenti con i consulenti alla vendita

Registrazione, archiviazione e gestione della documentazione commerciale e contrattuale

Coordinamento quotidiano con il team commerciale e il personale di vendita

Requisiti richiesti:

Diploma di scuola superiore

Buone capacità organizzative e relazionali

Conoscenze informatiche di base (pacchetto Office, posta elettronica)

Attitudine al lavoro in team e orientamento al cliente

Offerta:

Contratto a tempo determinato di 3 mesi prorogabile

Orario full time, 40 ore settimanali su turni

Formazione iniziale sul ruolo e sulle procedure aziendali.

Title: Addetto/a al Front Office – Settore Carta
HTML:
Azienda attiva a livello nazionale nel settore della carta seleziona una risorsa da inserire con il ruolo di addetto/a al front office.

La figura sarà responsabile delle attività di accoglienza e gestione operativa del punto di contatto con la clientela, con mansioni organizzative e di supporto amministrativo.

Attività previste:

Accoglienza clienti e gestione delle attività collegate;

Organizzazione e pianificazione degli appuntamenti;

Smistamento delle chiamate e della corrispondenza;

Inserimento dati nei sistemi aziendali;

Controllo accessi.

Requisiti richiesti:

Diploma di scuola secondaria di secondo grado;

Precisione, attenzione al dettaglio e capacità organizzativa;

Ottime doti relazionali e orientamento al cliente.

Offerta:

Contratto a tempo determinato;

Orario full time: dal lunedì al venerdì;

Benefit: buoni pasto e telefono aziendale.

Title: Segretario/a
Description:
Azienda affermata nel settore marketing, che dopo un’attenta analisi del mercato, progetta e promuove soluzioni digitali orientate a ottenere migliori risultati, ricerca una figura di addetto/a alla segreteria, per ampliamento dell’organico.

La risorsa si occuperà principalmente di:

supporto e assistenza al cliente

gestione delle chiamate in entrate e in uscita

gestione dei programmi informatici aziendali

promozione dei servizi dell'azienda

amministrazione ordinaria

Requisiti:

ottime doti comunicative

capacità organizzative

buona predisposizione al rapporto con la clientela e alla comunicazione

spirito di squadra

voglia di lavorare in team

Offerta:

assunzione diretta da parte dell'azienda, con contratto a tempo determinato ed in full time

Title: Técnico/a Inteligencia de Negocio (Temporal)
Description:
Información clave:

Equipo: D.E. Movilidad Iberia, en Inteligencia de Negocio.

Localización: Madrid, España

Experiencia en el análisis de datos

Tipo de trabajo: Temporal e híbrido

Requisitos: inglés B2 o superior + Licenciatura o superior

El equipo al que te unes:

En el Área de Inteligencia de Negocio trabajamos cada día para obtener el máximo retorno en la gestión de la Dirección de Movilidad. En un mercado cada vez más dinámico y competitivo, contar con modelos avanzados de decisión en base a datos es un reto estratégico para el negocio.

Estamos estamos buscando un perfil capaz de entender las necesidades de negocio y utilizar sus capacidades analíticas para optimizar la estrategia de decisión.

Trabajar con nosotros te permitirá participar de la transformación del negocio a la vez que te desarrollas como data analyst en una empresa internacional líder en el sector y con las últimas herramientas disponibles en el mercado.

Principales tareas:


Análisis de datos: Preparación, extracción y limpieza de datos disponibles para proponer cambios e innovaciones ad hoc en un marco de mejora continua de la gestión área de negocio y de optimización de las ventas de carburantes y otros productos del área de movilidad.
Visualización de datos: definición de KPIs de negocio y desarrollo de Dashboards.
Gestión de grandes volúmenes de datos: integración automática de datos y tratamiento de información incompleta y/o imperfecta procedente de distintas fuentes.



Qué ofrecemos:


Contrato temporal
Bonus según objetivos
Seguro médico
Aportación a plan de pensiones
Desconexión digital
Medidas de conciliación
Asesoría legal
Servicios de apoyo al empleado



Encajarás en el puesto si:


Preferentemente titulación superior en ingeniería, física o matemática y estadística y en su defecto formación o curso en data.
Capacidad analítica y conocimiento de herramientas de Business Intelligence (deseable PowerBI)
Nivel B2 de inglés.
Familiarización con entorno AZURE.
Titulación en ingeniería computacional, en Big Data Analytics o asimilables.
Experiencia previa demostrable en proyectos relacionados con las funciones descritas.
Conocimientos de desarrollo en PySpark.
Familiarización con entorno AZURE.
Lenguajes de programación: SQL Python o R



Show more

Title: Administrador de Bases de Dados Junior
Description:
A Noesis Procura o Seguinte Perfil

Principais Tarefas e Responsabilidades:


Administração de bases de dados Open Source: Trabalha com tecnologias amplamente utilizadas, como PostgreSQL, MariaDB, MongoDB, Elasticsearch e OpenSearch
Scripting e Automação: Desenvolve soluções automatizadas que otimizem operações e processos
Análise de Performance e Tuning: Identifica e resolve pontos críticos de desempenho ao nível de sistema e aplicação, garantindo máxima eficiência.

Formação superior em Informática / similar
Conhecimentos sólidos em Sistemas Operativos Unix (AIX) e Linux
Forte capacidade em Scripting utilizando Shell Script
Interesse em administração de base de dados Open Source: Postgresql ; Mariadb versão 10. x ; Mongodb versão 2. x a 7. x ; Elasticsearch versão 8. x Opensearch versão 2. x


Se reúnes estas condições e gostarias de integrar uma organização inovadora, que aposta continuamente na formação dos seus talentos, envia-nos a tua candidatura.

Join us. Let’s innovate together!

Todos os nossos processos de recrutamento e seleção baseiam-se na igualdade de oportunidades, valorizando a competência e o potencial de cada pessoa e garantindo que nenhum candidato ou candidata é discriminado com base em género, etnia, orientação sexual, idade, religião ou condição física.

Title: Fraud BI Analyst
HTML:
A SIBS presta serviços financeiros modernos, fiáveis e seguros a mais de 300 milhões de utilizadores, em três Continentes, processando anualmente mais de 4 mil milhões de transações.


Junta-te a nós nesta batalha do “bem contra o mal”, fazendo parte dos que ajudarão a proteger as transações dos cartões e comerciantes portugueses, dos 6 milhões de utilizadores do MB WAY, ATMs MULTIBANCO, home banking, ou mesmo as chamadas à API SIBS pelos developers e outras fintechs que querem disponibilizar a próxima geração de aplicações financeiras e de pagamento.


Irás ajudar a identificar os esquemas dos fraudsters, descobrir as ligações escondidas e criar modelos acionáveis que irão rastrear em tempo real mais de 25 milhões de transações por dia, no espaço de apenas alguns milissegundos.


Farás parte da equipa que fornece os melhores modelos de prevenção de fraude que permitem à SIBS oferecer uma experiência de pagamento de topo, ao mesmo tempo que garantimos que o dinheiro de todos está seguro. Irás ter acesso a uma grande infraestrutura de dados que aproveita o nosso data lake exclusivo e combina dados em todos os canais e serviços que monitorizamos, proporcionando uma visão completa e abrangente do sistema de pagamentos português.



Na SIBS, ter um efeito positivo em milhões de utilizadores é o nosso lema de do dia-a-dia. Aceitas o desafio?



Como Fraud BI Analyst irás desempenhar as seguintes funções:

  • Desenvolver reports e dashboards que permitem acompanhar a performance das nossas estratégias de prevenção de fraude para os diversos produtos, serviços e geografias;
  • Desenvolver soluções analíticas e de reporting que permitem aos nossos clientes acompanhar os impactos da atividade de prevenção de fraude no seu negócio;
  • Trabalhar com os nossos Data Scientists para monitorizar e entregar uma performance e otimização de topo aos nossos modelos de ML;
  • Trabalhar com a nossa equipa de operações de prevenção de fraude no acompanhamento da atividade da equipa;
  • Trabalhar com a nossa equipa de negócio e gestão de serviço na resposta a pedidos de desenvolvimento de cliente e em análises ad-hoc;
  • Desafiar os atuais processos, promovendo soluções industrializáveis e automatizáveis;
  • Identificar novas fontes de dados que permitam adicionar valor ao nosso data lake.


Perfil:

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, Estatística, Matemática Aplicada, Gestão, Economia ou similares;
  • Experiência prévia em funções analíticas, com mínimo de 1/2 anos;
  • Excelente capacidade de análise e resolução de problemas;
  • Experiência no desenvolvimento com ferramentas de visualização, MS PowerBI será valorizado;
  • Proficiência em SQL e DAX;
  • Experiência no desenho e implementação de processos ETL;
  • Experiência prévia com Databricks será valorizada;
  • Experiência em deteção de fraude será valorizada.


Benefícios:

  • Oportunidade de desenvolver projetos desafiantes e de grande dimensão numa empresa de crescimento continuado, que há mais de 40 anos aposta no investimento e na inovação tecnológica;
  • Acesso a um conjunto de benefícios atrativos: Subsídio de Alimentação superior aos valores médios de mercado; Pacote de Seguros; Pacote de Comunicações Móveis; Acesso a protocolos com diversos parceiros;
  • Perspetivas de desenvolvimento e crescimento profissional;
  • Excelente ambiente de trabalho.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, Client Services

About 4mativ Technologies, Inc.

4MATIV Technologies manages multi-modal mobility for school systems nationwide with technology to expand options and enhance service. We envision a future where all children have access to the learning opportunities that maximize their potential, and we are reimagining transportation to accelerate student outcomes.

We partner with schools to improve service, safety, and holistic sustainability, ensuring all students have access to the right ride. Currently, we manage transportation for over 50 school districts across cities including Houston, Indianapolis, Minneapolis-St. Paul, and Phoenix, simplifying operations and expanding services for families. Every school day, 4MATIV manages outsourced vendors and operates a contact center supporting more than 22,000 student trips across over 1,000 routes for schools across the country.

Our Client Services team provides tailored advisory and analysis services. 4MATIV works hand in hand with education organizations to design flexible, local solutions that meet the needs of every learner. We partner with school districts to optimize transportation systems, identify efficiencies, and design lasting solutions. We support some of the nation's largest public school districts and charter organizations as trusted mobility advisors. Our projects aim to enhance client understanding and empower them to drive meaningful system improvements. Data-driven insights are at the core of our work, using advanced analysis and tools to set us apart in the industry.

Our team is committed to:


Working shoulder-to-shoulder with our clients as a mission-aligned and trusted partner
Valuing diversity of perspectives and experiences
Care for every detail and outcome
Constant learning and improvement


Position Overview

4MATIV is a rapidly growing company with an increasingly broad portfolio of consulting clients. As our list of client districts and state education agencies grows, the need for a robust, productive, and knowledgeable team of analysts is increasingly important to our business. This key member to our growing team will have the ability to contribute greatly to the direction and operation of this team and business function. We're looking for someone that is enthusiastic, willing to bring new ideas, and looking to learn and grow alongside the company.

The Data Analyst will play a key role in crafting intuitive, insightful, and rigorous analyses that inspire and guide our clients to implement new student mobility innovations. The ideal candidate is a quick learner, is self-motivated, is analytically gifted, has a drive for creative optimization, and can manage data processes from beginning to end. The candidate will be able to handle a variety of analytical tasks including but not limited to: descriptive analysis of student transportation system performance and configuration, geospatial analysis and visualization of students/schools/terminals, estimation of the impact of different changes to system configuration and optimization (in terms of costs, efficiency, and emissions), and data pipelining. While our team utilizes standardized templates, reusable code, and documented analytic processes, client data is frequently incomplete; this role requires someone who is flexible, innovative, able to make smart assumptions, and capable of leveraging proxy variables in order to produce useful analysis.

Responsibilities


Lead assigned analysis projects from start to finish, delivering results on time while collaborating effectively with colleagues on resources and timelines
Perform in-depth data analysis with self-direction and accuracy, building models to optimize transportation operations and enhance efficiency for school systems
Develop and run reusable Python scripts to automate processes and conduct data analysis
Deploy clear commenting and process documentation to ensure the code is decipherable and usable by other staff members.
Create and maintain Excel, Google Sheets and other models for consultative projects and or internal operational use.
Use business knowledge, code scripts, and software processes to clean, spot-check, and prepare data from various sources.
Continuously enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of technical task and project delivery, ensuring streamlined processes and minimizing any operational bottlenecks.
Ensure the accuracy and reliability of technical deliverables through application of rigorous quality control measures and review processes.
Integrate data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, consistency, and accessibility across systems
Summarize, visualize, and present findings to clients in a clear, concise, and engaging manner
Leverage GIS software to produce informative and actionable maps and geospatial insights for both client-facing and internal projects.
Communicate methodologies, assumptions, results, and the significance of analyses through clear written reports and presentations
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand client needs and challenges, translating these into actionable data insights to guide decision-making and strategic initiatives
Uphold and contribute to the continuous improvement of company code documentation standards and data governance policies, ensuring data quality, privacy, and security


Requirements

The candidate should have education and/or experience working with large sets of data in an analytical capacity. The candidate should be detail-oriented and self-motivated in order to drive business processes to completion. The requirements for this position are:

Education and Experience:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
Two (2) years of analytic experience in a relevant field
Experience in data operations in transportation, logistics, or K-12 Education preferred


Technical Skills:


Proficiency in Python & SQL
Proficiency working with data visualization tools such as Microsoft PowerBI
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets
Proficiency working with APIs
Experience with GIS software


Core Competencies:


User-focus: Maintains consistent focus on the overarching purpose of analyses, ensuring analyses meet user needs while considering the user experience and perspective.
Self-motivation: Takes initiative, working independently with minimal supervision, setting clear goals, and driving progress. Demonstrated ability to exceed goals and have a bottom-line, action focused orientation
Problem-solving: Tackles complex data projects with persistence, creativity, and a strong curiosity to find innovative solutions
Attention to details: Effectively manages multiple tasks, prioritizing work to deliver thorough, error-free results on-time
Effective communication: Exhibits strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to engage diverse stakeholders clearly and professionally. High capacity for leading and partnering with people cross-functionally in a collaborative environment


Benefits

Salary Range: $85,000 - $100,000, per year

Benefits:


401(k)
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Paid time off
Parental leave
Vision insurance
Show more

This key member to our growing team will have the ability to contribute greatly to the direction and operation of this team and business function. We're looking for someone that is enthusiastic, willing to bring new ideas, and looking to learn and grow alongside the company.

The Data Analyst will play a key role in crafting intuitive, insightful, and rigorous analyses that inspire and guide our clients to implement new student mobility innovations. The ideal candidate is a quick learner, is self-motivated, is analytically gifted, has a drive for creative optimization, and can manage data processes from beginning to end. The candidate will be able to handle a variety of analytical tasks including but not limited to: descriptive analysis of student transportation system performance and configuration, geospatial analysis and visualization of students/schools/terminals, estimation of the impact of different changes to system configuration and optimization (in terms of costs, efficiency, and emissions), and data pipelining. While our team utilizes standardized templates, reusable code, and documented analytic processes, client data is frequently incomplete; this role requires someone who is flexible, innovative, able to make smart assumptions, and capable of leveraging proxy variables in order to produce useful analysis.

Responsibilities

  • Lead assigned analysis projects from start to finish, delivering results on time while collaborating effectively with colleagues on resources and timelines
  • Perform in-depth data analysis with self-direction and accuracy, building models to optimize transportation operations and enhance efficiency for school systems
  • Develop and run reusable Python scripts to automate processes and conduct data analysis
  • Deploy clear commenting and process documentation to ensure the code is decipherable and usable by other staff members.
  • Create and maintain Excel, Google Sheets and other models for consultative projects and or internal operational use.
  • Use business knowledge, code scripts, and software processes to clean, spot-check, and prepare data from various sources.
  • Continuously enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of technical task and project delivery, ensuring streamlined processes and minimizing any operational bottlenecks.
  • Ensure the accuracy and reliability of technical deliverables through application of rigorous quality control measures and review processes.
  • Integrate data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, consistency, and accessibility across systems
  • Summarize, visualize, and present findings to clients in a clear, concise, and engaging manner
  • Leverage GIS software to produce informative and actionable maps and geospatial insights for both client-facing and internal projects.
  • Communicate methodologies, assumptions, results, and the significance of analyses through clear written reports and presentations
  • Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand client needs and challenges, translating these into actionable data insights to guide decision-making and strategic initiatives
  • Uphold and contribute to the continuous improvement of company code documentation standards and data governance policies, ensuring data quality, privacy, and security

Requirements

The candidate should have education and/or experience working with large sets of data in an analytical capacity. The candidate should be detail-oriented and self-motivated in order to drive business processes to completion. The requirements for this position are:

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
  • Two (2) years of analytic experience in a relevant field
  • Experience in data operations in transportation, logistics, or K-12 Education preferred

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in Python & SQL
  • Proficiency working with data visualization tools such as Microsoft PowerBI
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets
  • Proficiency working with APIs
  • Experience with GIS software

Core Competencies:

  • User-focus: Maintains consistent focus on the overarching purpose of analyses, ensuring analyses meet user needs while considering the user experience and perspective.
  • Self-motivation: Takes initiative, working independently with minimal supervision, setting clear goals, and driving progress. Demonstrated ability to exceed goals and have a bottom-line, action focused orientation
  • Problem-solving: Tackles complex data projects with persistence, creativity, and a strong curiosity to find innovative solutions
  • Attention to details: Effectively manages multiple tasks, prioritizing work to deliver thorough, error-free results on-time
  • Effective communication: Exhibits strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to engage diverse stakeholders clearly and professionally. High capacity for leading and partnering with people cross-functionally in a collaborative environment

Benefits

Salary Range: $85,000 - $100,000, per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Flexible schedule
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Parental leave
  • Vision insurance

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
About ConnectPrep: Our goal is to redefine "tutoring" - to use data, insight, and our extensive teaching experience find solutions for our students. ConnectPrep is about connecting - connecting students, parents, educators, and the community. We have bold ideas and an eye towards the future.

The Opportunity: We are offering a Data Analyst Internship for qualified candidates. This is a cross-disciplinary role, both instructional and technical. You'll engage with our team of educators to validate and iterate the models that drive our analytics. Our Data Analysts develop an understanding of our algorithms, the technologies and platforms that support our products, and our proprietary educational content. This knowledge will then be synthesized into actionable tests to build modules that will assist in identifying the academic needs of each individual student. You will engage with team members that think outside of the box, with the goal of improving education through the creation of a data infrastructure and insightful analytics.

Requirements

What we are looking for:


Creative problem solving, strong math/quantitative skills, and attention to detail
A background in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or Computer Science
Ability to brainstorm ways we can use our product to collect data that provides insight into the needs of our students
Experience with SQL, Pandas, or other fast analysis language
Experience in data analysis or building pipeline tools in Python
Some coding background and a strong interest in technology
Advanced Excel skills (Advanced Formulas)
Tables & Formatting
Conditional Formatting
Advanced Charting
Pivot tables & Pivot Reporting
VBA & Macros
Using Excel Productively
Data Tables, Simulations & Solver


Benefits

Why join ConnectPrep?


Get in on the ground floor of an exciting new company, with the potential to help shape our direction
Be involved with a team that has bold ideas, with the goal of reinventing education across the globe
Gain valuable experience, meet technology innovators, and learn about the business side of our company


Sound Interesting?

Please submit your resume and letter of interest at careers@connectprep.com.

All applicants must be a U.S. Citizen or National of the U.S., an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence, or an alien authorized to work in the U.S. for this employer. ConnectPrep is an equal opportunity employer EEO/M/F/D/V.
Show more
