Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A3041080

Title: Senior Analyst, Data and Analysis
Description:
Senior Analyst, Data & Analysis




The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients.




To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Senior Analyst – someone who can analyze massive data sets, make insightful cross-channel recommendations, and communicate strategic ideas to clients. Sound like you? Read on.




As a Senior Analyst, you’ll build the strategic and tactical foundation for data-driven marketing efforts. You’ll work to achieve client goals through brand and acquisition campaigns, site optimization, and/or online testing strategy.




Day-to-day, your role includes:

Instituting frameworks across project and campaign lifecycles, including measurement plans, primary and secondary research, and performance reporting
Diving into large data sets, uncovering insights, and providing impactful recommendations to clients
Connecting the dots across channels through data (including display media, site, search, email, and social) to provide a holistic view of marketing efforts
Communicating with clients regularly on scheduled deliverables and ad-hoc requests
Collaborating with internal teams and external partners to drive success for client’s business goals




Qualifications:

3-5 years of experience in analytics or strategy
A four-year college degree
Passion for digital marketing and emerging trends in the digital landscape
Experience communicating with internal and external stakeholders at a variety of levels
Fluency with Excel (including pivot tables and vlookups) and/or other data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau
Comfortable in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment
Familiarity with prompt-based interaction and commonly used generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Google Gemini, DALL·E, Midjourney) is a plus, especially for tasks like ideation, research, or content generation.




Got the sparkle? Apply if you believe your unique skills are a fit.




2025-117285




Additional Information:

Digitas is an equal opportunity employer. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.




If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact USMSTACompliance@publicis.com.




Compensation Range: $72,390.00 - $104,720 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. Temporary roles may be eligible to participate in our freelancer/temporary employee medical plan through a third-party benefits administration system once certain criteria have been met. Temporary roles may also qualify for participation in our 401(k) plan after eligibility criteria have been met. For regular roles, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 09/15/2025.




About Digitas:

Digitas is the Networked Experience Agency, built on the vision that we create magnetic experiences that earn the right for brands to exist in human networks. Today, and tomorrow. We deliver Networked Experiences by leveraging comprehensive data, technology, creative, media and strategy capabilities. Digitas delivers ambitious outcomes via unique solutions that include Creative Experiences, Integrated Media, Addressable Relationships, Social Marketing and Total Commerce.




Celebrated by AdAge as Data and Insights Agency of the Year, U.S Campaign’s Brand Experience Agency of the Year, Media Network of the Year and celebrated by Forrester and Gartner, Digitas serves the world’s leading brands through a global network comprised of more than 5,500 employees across over 65 offices in 43 countries.




The Digitas culture is made up of fearless, inventive and generous Unicorns of all kinds.

HTML:
Senior Analyst, Data & Analysis


The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients.


To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Senior Analyst – someone who can analyze massive data sets, make insightful cross-channel recommendations, and communicate strategic ideas to clients. Sound like you? Read on.


As a Senior Analyst, you’ll build the strategic and tactical foundation for data-driven marketing efforts. You’ll work to achieve client goals through brand and acquisition campaigns, site optimization, and/or online testing strategy.


Day-to-day, your role includes:

  • Instituting frameworks across project and campaign lifecycles, including measurement plans, primary and secondary research, and performance reporting
  • Diving into large data sets, uncovering insights, and providing impactful recommendations to clients
  • Connecting the dots across channels through data (including display media, site, search, email, and social) to provide a holistic view of marketing efforts
  • Communicating with clients regularly on scheduled deliverables and ad-hoc requests
  • Collaborating with internal teams and external partners to drive success for client’s business goals


Qualifications:

  • 3-5 years of experience in analytics or strategy
  • A four-year college degree
  • Passion for digital marketing and emerging trends in the digital landscape
  • Experience communicating with internal and external stakeholders at a variety of levels
  • Fluency with Excel (including pivot tables and vlookups) and/or other data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau
  • Comfortable in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment
  • Familiarity with prompt-based interaction and commonly used generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Google Gemini, DALL·E, Midjourney) is a plus, especially for tasks like ideation, research, or content generation.


Got the sparkle? Apply if you believe your unique skills are a fit.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:

American Technology Consulting (ATC) is a service-first tech company dedicated to helping businesses unlock their full potential through innovative technology solutions. We empower organizations to leverage data for smarter decisions and meaningful impact. At ATC, we foster a culture of growth and invite passionate individuals to join our team, contribute to impactful projects, and excel as data-driven problem solvers. We embrace diversity and welcome candidates from all educational and professional backgrounds, including recent Master’s graduates without prior technical experience.




Job Overview:

As an Entry-Level Data Analyst at ATC, you will be at the forefront of turning raw data into actionable insights. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to work on real-world challenges, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and apply your problem-solving skills in a supportive and innovative environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and organize data to prepare it for analysis.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations using statistical and analytical tools.
Develop insightful dashboards, visualizations, and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel.
Assist teams in making data-driven decisions by presenting clear and concise insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency through validation and quality checks.
Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and new data tools or technologies.




Qualifications:

Master’s degree.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and a willingness to learn data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
Excellent communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.
Candidates must have U.S. work authorization.




Preferred Qualifications:

Internship or project experience in data analysis or visualization.
Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing databases.
Knowledge of statistical concepts and tools like Python or R (a plus but not required).




What We Offer:

Career Growth: Opportunity to advance in a dynamic and supportive work environment.
Mentorship: Guidance and training from experienced professionals in the field.
Diversity in Projects: Work across various industries and innovative technologies.
Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, health insurance, and other perks.




Work Authorization Support:

H1B sponsorship or related visa support for eligible candidates.
Applications from individuals on F1/OPT are welcome.




Equal Opportunity Commitment:

ATC is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees can thrive.

Title: Real Estate Data Entry Operator
Description:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of Better Homes and Gardens Real Estate Advantage Realty. We are currently looking for a Real Estate Data Entry Operator in Pennsylvania (USA).

This role offers the opportunity to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and organization of real estate data in a fast-paced and remote work environment. The position involves updating and maintaining client, transaction, and property records while supporting reporting and administrative tasks. Ideal candidates are detail-oriented, highly organized, and able to work independently while collaborating with team members to resolve discrepancies. This position plays a vital role in ensuring data integrity, supporting operational efficiency, and contributing to informed decision-making within the real estate business. Candidates who thrive in structured environments, enjoy working with databases, and take pride in precision will excel in this role.

Accountabilities:


Accurately update and maintain real estate transactions, client information, and property data within the database
Review, verify, and correct data to ensure accuracy and completeness
Collaborate with team members to identify and resolve discrepancies in records
Ensure compliance with privacy and data security regulations
Support reporting and presentation creation using the data collected
Perform general administrative and secretarial duties, including filing, scanning, printing, and monitoring office supplies as needed



Requirements


High school diploma or equivalent; Bachelor's degree is preferred but not required
Previous experience in data entry or a related field
Knowledge of real estate processes, terminology, and procedures
Proficiency with computers, including MS Office applications and data entry software
Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Strong organizational and time management skills
Effective communication skills, especially when working remotely in a team environment



Benefits


Competitive hourly pay: $26.81-$29.97, based on experience and qualifications
Opportunity to work remotely with a flexible schedule
Supportive team environment emphasizing collaboration and accuracy
Exposure to real estate data management and reporting tools
Opportunity to develop skills in database management and administrative support


Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven matching.

When you apply, your profile goes through an AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly.

🔍 Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience, and achievements.

📊 It compares your profile to the role's core requirements and past success factors to determine a match score.

🎯 The 3 candidates with the highest match are automatically shortlisted.

🧠 When necessary, our human team may perform an additional review to ensure no strong profile is missed.

The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias — focusing solely on your fit for the role. Once shortlisting is completed, we share it with the hiring company, who will decide on next steps such as interviews or assessments.

Thank you for your interest!
